title.rendered: “IDF Strikes Hezbollah Targets in Southern Lebanon: Latest Updates and Developments”

content.rendered:
IDF Spokesperson:

A military structure where terrorists were present alongside four launchers; the IDF has completed additional strikes in southern Lebanon.

Golani reconnaissance troops identified earlier today (Saturday) terrorists entering a military structure of the terrorist organization Hezbollah in Markaba in southern Lebanon. In a closing of the loop from the air, fighter jets struck the structure where the terrorists were located.

Additionally, fighter jets attacked shortly ago four launchers of the terrorist organization Hezbollah in the areas of Shihin, Zabqin, Hanin, and Holi in southern Lebanon.

Following warnings activated at 7:15 PM in the Upper Galilee area, about five launches were identified crossing from Lebanese territory and landing in open areas. As a result of the launches, fires developed in the region.

Furthermore, several anti-tank missile launches were identified crossing from Lebanon towards the areas of Malkiya and Misgav Am, which resulted in a fire in Misgav Am. There are also reports of damage to structures in Malkiya and Misgav Am due to the launches.

IDF forces have attacked all sources of fire with artillery.

Firefighting forces are currently working to extinguish the fire hotspots; in all incidents, there are no casualties.

Attached is footage from the strikes: https://bit.ly/3x9KUBG
